eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Recolorizer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Independently change the colors of a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.
description: This extension allows to restyle a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.
- Change the color of player short according to its team color.
- Add small color variation to trees of a forest.
- Restyle objects to match other assets.
An example shows how to change the 2 main colors of an object ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://recolorizer)).
This extension is experimental and might no longer work in future version of GDevelop.

inlineCode: * Converts an HSL color value to RGB. Conversion formula
* Assumes h, s, and l are contained in the set [0, 1] and
* returns r, g, and b in the set [0, 255].
var hue2rgb = function hue2rgb(p, q, t) {
var q = l < 0.5 ? l * (1 + s) : l + s - l * s;
* Converts an RGB color value to HSL. Conversion formula
* Assumes r, g, and b are contained in the set [0, 255] and
* returns h, s, and l in the set [0, 1].
var max = Math.max(r, g, b), min = Math.min(r, g, b);
s = l > 0.5 ? d / (2 - max - min) : d / (max + min);
case r: h = (g - b) / d + (g < b ? 6 : 0); break;
case g: h = (b - r) / d + 2; break;
case b: h = (r - g) / d + 4; break;
* Replace a color with an other one.
* @param {{x: number, y: number, width: number, height: number}} frame
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
const recolorizeTexture = function (sourceCanvas, targetCanvas, frame, originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
// hue is not knowned for graycase colors.
// graycase pixels must take the targeted hue
pixelHsl[0] = pixelSaturation === 0 ? targetHue : gdjs.evtTools.common.mod(pixelHue - originHue + targetHue, 1);
// white pixels must also take the targeted saturation.
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
const getRecolorizationKey = function (originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
* Manage recolorizations to ensure uniqueness of textures.
* Register a recolorization usage and get recolored textures.
* @param {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} recolorizations
recolorizedSprite = { userCount: 0, textures: targetTextures, canvas: targetCanvas };
* Apply a recoloration to every textures.
* @param {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} recolorizations
/** @type {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} */
* Replace a color with an other one.
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
Recolorizer.prototype.recolorizeSprite = function (originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
this.recolorizationKey += getRecolorizationKey(originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope);
this.recolorizations.push({ originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope});
* Reset the default textures of the object.
* Update the textures of the object.

eventsFunctions.description: Replace a given color of an object with another one. The scope allows to change similar colors at once.
eventsFunctions.name: Recolorize
eventsFunctions.sentence: Recolorize _PARAM0_ from color _PARAM2_ to color _PARAM3_ within a scope of  hue: _PARAM4_° saturation: _PARAM5_% lightness: _PARAM6_%

eventsFunctions.description: Set back the original colors of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetColor

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PlatformerCharacterAnimator
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Change animations and horizontal flipping of a platformer character automatically.
description: Automatically change the animations and horizontal flipping of a platformer character based on movement and interaction with platform objects.
The platformer example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change animations and horizontal flipping of a platformer character automatically.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PlatformerCharacterAnimator

events.name: Flip character based on input from controls
Flip character based on input from controls

eventsFunctions.description: Enable (or disable) automated animation changes a platformer character. Disabling animation changes is useful to play custom animations.
eventsFunctions.name: EnableChangingAnimations

eventsFunctions.description: Enable (or disable) automated horizontal flipping of a platform character.
eventsFunctions.name: EnableHorizontalFlipping

eventsFunctions.description: Set the "Idle" animation name. Do not use quotation marks.
eventsFunctions.name: SetIdleAnimationName

eventsFunctions.description: Set the "Move" animation name. Do not use quotation marks.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMoveAnimationName

eventsFunctions.description: Set the "Jump" animation name. Do not use quotation marks.
eventsFunctions.name: SetJumpAnimationName

eventsFunctions.description: Set the "Fall" animation name. Do not use quotation marks.
eventsFunctions.name: SetFallAnimationName

eventsFunctions.description: Set the "Climb" animation name. Do not use quotation marks.
eventsFunctions.name: SetClimbAnimationName

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BehaviorRemapper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Quickly remap Behavior controls to different keys.
description: Make sure to disable default controls unless you want two keys to do the same action.
Actions have two versions. `custom` allow the movement keys to be changed to what ever you would like. `presets` provide a common key-bindings that can be selected from a list.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows for the controls of a Top-Down behavior to be re-mapped via a single action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RemapForTopdown

eventsFunctions.description: Remaps Top-Down behavior controls to a custom control scheme.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Remap Top-Down controls to a custom scheme
eventsFunctions.name: SetCustom
eventsFunctions.sentence: Remap controls of _PARAM0_: Up: _PARAM2_, Left: _PARAM3_, Down: _PARAM4_, Right: _PARAM5_

eventsFunctions.description: Remaps Top-Down behavior controls to a preset control scheme.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Remap Top-Down controls to a preset
eventsFunctions.name: SetPreset

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows for the controls of a platformer behavior to be re-mapped via a single action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RemapForPlatformer

eventsFunctions.description: Remaps Platformer behavior controls to a custom control scheme.

eventsFunctions.fullName: Remap Platformer controls to a preset
